title: Wangzhuoran’s hands-on exercise
text: Welcome to ISSS608 Visual Analytics and Applications. In this website, you will find my coursework prepared for this course.

title: About
text:
About this site

1 + 1

[1] 2

title: Hands-on_Ex01
text:
Install and launching R packages.
The code chunk below uses p_load() of pacman package to check if tidyverse packages are installed in the computer. If they are, then they will be launched into R.

pacman::p_load(tidyverse)

title: Hands-on_Ex01
text:
Install and launching R packages.
The code chunk below uses p_load() of pacman package to check if tidyverse packages are installed in the computer. If they are, then they will be launched into R.

pacman::p_load(tidyverse)

title: Hands-on_Ex01
text:
Importing the data

exam_data <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")

Rows: 322 Columns: 7
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (4): ID, CLASS, GENDER, RACE
dbl (3): ENGLISH, MATHS, SCIENCE

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

title: Hands-on_Ex01
text:
Plotting a simple bar chart

ggplot(data = exam_data,
aes(x = RACE)) +
geom_bar()

title: Hands-on_Ex01
text:
Dot Plot


Bin width defaults to 1/30 of the range of the data. Pick better value with
`binwidth`.










ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS)) +
  
  geom_dotplot(binwidth=2.5,
               dotsize= 0.5) +
  scale_y_continuous(NULL,
                      breaks = NULL)

title: Hands-on_Ex01
text:
Histogram

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram()

`stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value `binwidth`.










ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 20,
                 color = "black",
                 fill = "lightblue")









Modify Via aes changes

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS,
           fill = GENDER)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 20,
                color = "gray")

title: Hands-on_Ex01
text:
Density Graph

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_density()









ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS,
           colours = GENDER)) +
  geom_density()

title: Hands-on_Ex01
text:
Box Plot

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(y = MATHS,
           x = GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot()









Box Plot With Notches (Show Median)

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(y = MATHS,
           x = GENDER)) + 
  geom_boxplot(notch = TRUE)

title: Hands-on_Ex01
text:
Violin Graph (geom_violin())

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(y = MATHS,
           x = GENDER)) +
  geom_violin()

title: Hands-on_Ex01
text:
Point Graph (geom_point())

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS,
           y = ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point()

title: Hands-on_Ex01
text:
Combined Graph (Box plot + Point)

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(y = MATHS,
           x = GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  geom_point(position = "jitter",
             size = 0.5)

title: Hands-on_Ex01
text:
stat_summary() method

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(y = MATHS,
           x = GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  stat_summary(geom = "point",
               fun = "mean",
               colour = "red",
               size = 4)

title: Hands-on_Ex01
text:
geom() method

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(y = MATHS,
           x = GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  geom_point(stat = "summary",
             fun = "mean",
             colour = "red",
             size = 4)

title: Hands-on_Ex01
section: Addming Best Fit Curve for SCatter plot
text:
Addming Best Fit Curve for SCatter plot

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS,
           y = ENGLISH)) + 
  geom_point() + 
  geom_smooth(size = 0.5)

Warning: Using `size` aesthetic for lines was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0.
ℹ Please use `linewidth` instead.


`geom_smooth()` using method = 'loess' and formula = 'y ~ x'










ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS,
           y = ENGLISH)) + 
  geom_point() + 
  geom_smooth(method = lm,
              linewidth = 0.5)

`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'

title: Hands-on_Ex01
text:
facet_grid()

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS)) + 
  geom_histogram(bins = 20) +
  facet_grid(~ CLASS)

title: Hands-on_Ex01
text:
coord_flip()

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = RACE)) +
  geom_bar() +
  coord_flip()









fixing x and y range using coord_cartesian()

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS,
           y = ENGLISH)) + 
  geom_point() + 
  geom_smooth(method = lm,
              size = 0.5) +
  coord_cartesian(xlim = c(0,100),
                  ylim = c(0,100))

`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'

title: Hands-on_Ex01
text:
theme_gray()

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = RACE)) + 
  geom_bar() +
  coord_flip() +
  theme_gray()

title: Hands-on_Ex01
text:
theme_classic()

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = RACE)) + 
  geom_bar() +
  coord_flip() +
  theme_classic()

title: Hands-on_Ex01
text:
Theme Minimal
ggplot(data = exam_data, aes(x = RACE)) + geom_bar() + coord_flip() + theme_minimal()
